net.cloud.client.file.request

Class XmlLoadRequest<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.client.file.request.FileRequest<T>
      • net.cloud.client.file.request.LoadRequest<T>
        • net.cloud.client.file.request.XmlLoadRequest<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the object being deserialized

    public class XmlLoadRequest<T>
extends LoadRequest<T>
    A request to deserialize from an XML file. Rather than requesting a file descriptor type object, the parameter type of this request is actually the type of the object being deserialized.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XmlLoadRequest(FileAddress address)
      Simply calls the super constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlLoadRequest

        public XmlLoadRequest(FileAddress address)
        Simply calls the super constructor. See LoadRequest.LoadRequest(FileAddress)
        Parameters:
        address - The location of the file

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(RequestHandler handler)
        Description copied from class: FileRequest
        Have the request ship itself off for handling. This takes advantage of dynamic binding. More specifically, double dispatch. Simply override it and call handler.handleRequest(this)
        Specified by:
        handle in class FileRequest<T>
        Parameters:
        handler - An instance of RequestHandler to take care of this request

      • getObject

        public T getObject()
            throws FileRequestException
        Obtain the deserialized object. Equivalent to FileRequest.getFileDescriptor() but renamed for more clarity. Same caveats.
        Returns:
        The object that was deserialized from XML
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If the object has not been created yet
